channel.title: Please help or im gonnna rage irl! lol ;)
channel.description:
Basicly i download overloadx client and source, but basicly it won't let me on. I put the right port that rsps's use, the 43.... one and i replaced its ip with mine. theres a "overdosepking.no-ip.biz" to the left of my ip, do i need to replace it? cus i compiled everything and when i try to log in, it says "error connnecting to server" please help? <3
Filippo. The good talker and un-depressioner peopler lol?

You guys have been extremely helpful, but i have been told lots of things, durial, and others who are good with this can you add my msn please?

Filippo@tammaro.co.uk

item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“durial12, post:12, topic:389791”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=485698.msg3559339#msg3559339 date=1302133219]
On my current server, in the server files I’ve set it to my no-ip and it works. :S
[/quote]

But does it work though? = ;)[/quote]
Yeah 'cos we couldn’t login yesterday after I changed it lol.

item.title: Please help or im gonnna rage irl! lol ;)
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

Mendorphins:

On my current server, in the server files I’ve set it to my no-ip and it works. :S

But does it work though? =

[quote=“Owner Zachs, post:11, topic:389791”]Alright… I havent read any other posts… So Sorry if someone already put this. But…

Client.java IN YOUR CLIENT FOLDER Search for like no-ip or something stupid like that. Find your ip Change it to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 Try both and do the same to GUI and find ur ip their and change it 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 W/e It is. Not sure… Alright your source folder should already be 0.0.0.0 DO NOT TOUCH THAT!!![/quote]

That’s pretty much a summary of what everyone has said.

Read full topic
item.source: Please help or im gonnna rage irl! lol ;)

item.title: Please help or im gonnna rage irl! lol ;)
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Zachs Owner Zachs
item.description:
@Owner_Zachs wrote:

Alright… I havent read any other posts… So Sorry if someone already put this. But…

Client.java IN YOUR CLIENT FOLDER Search for like no-ip or something stupid like that. Find your ip Change it to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 Try both and do the same to GUI and find ur ip their and change it 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 W/e It is. Not sure… Alright your source folder should already be 0.0.0.0 DO NOT TOUCH THAT!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Please help or im gonnna rage irl! lol ;)
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

The client as in what you load up to login with and the server as in the server you run to connect to and says “Server online port 43594” or whatever.

Check to see you have the same IP (localhost) and ports for both the client and server.

If you don’t understand that, let me know.

Read full topic
